summary:
Meet and Greet
Au where the Avengers don’t break up. 
Summary: It’s a year after the accords, and people seem to understand what...
body:
Meet and Greet

Au where the Avengers don’t break up.

Summary: It’s a year after the accords, and people seem to understand what really went on. The Avengers do meet and greets trying to be closer to the citizens. Finally Bucky is allowed access to the meet and greets, and a cute girl seems to catch his eye.

Warnings: just some nice fluff.

Word count: 989

“Bucky for the last time, you cannot get out of this. We have to try and get the favor of the citizens.” Steve groans. Bucky rolls his eyes. “I thought that’s why we weren’t in jail!” Steve just turned to open the car door. “Come on Buck. We’re here.”

Steve stepped out of the car, making his way to the area that Tony had booked. Bucky just sighed following his best friend. He doubted anyone would even show up in his line. Him being there was useless. People will always see him as the winter soldier, that’s just how it will be.

Once they got to the large open space Bucky took note of which Avengers attended this event. First was Sam Wilson, he had a pile of photos of him in his Falcon suit. Bucky tolled his eyes. “You looking for a modeling gig?” Bucky smirked, teasing Sam. Sam laughed, a slight glare in his eyes. “More like a girlfriend!”

Natsaha hit his shoulder as she sat in her seat next to him. “You wish!” They started to banter but Bucky left them to it. Next to Nat was Wanda. “Hey, Bucky! We’re glad you’re here!” Wanda gave him a thumbs in. Bucky smiled shyily. Then it was Steve’s seat, and of course at the end of the table was Bucky’s seat.

Steve stood up. “Alright they’re about to come in everyone! Let’s make the best impression!” Then right as he sat back down they filtered in like crazy. Steve got a lot of young girls and little boys in his line. Nat seemed to get a decent amount of teenage boys and girls. Sam got mostly what seemed like the teenagers parents, a few girls, and some little boys. Bucky laughed when Wilson made eye contact with him. Sam made a face of ‘I will kill you Bucky Barnes’. Wanda got a good mix of everybody.

Bucky just sat there and sighed, no line for him at all. He told Steve it would be useless. It seemed like two hours had passed and still not a single showed for Bucky showed up. “Only one hour left.” He mumbled to himself. A mantra he had been chanting to himself for the past hour.

Bucky has his feet up on the table and his eyes closed when Steve roughed pushed his shoulder. Bucky opened his eyes to punch him back but his eyes went straight to you. Coming up his empty line bounced a smiling girl. Bucky guessed you couldn’t of been older than 25.

Steve smirked at the look on his best friends face. Once you got close enough to the table to talk to Bucky, your happy going exterior dropped. “Hi.” You said in a small voice. Bucky could not believe it. Someone was in his line. They seemed excited to see him.

Bucky realized he was staring, shaking his head out of it. “Oh, H-Hello.” Bucky wanted to face palm himself. You smiled sweetly at him. “I’m Y/N.” You stuck your hand out for him to shake. You hoped he wouldn’t notice how badly it was shaking. Looking down at your hand for a few minutes too long, Steve elbowed Bucky snapping him back into reality.

He slowly wrapped his large calloused hand around your small one. He could tell just by looking at you, if the wind blew too hard you would get swept away. For some reason he wanted to protect you. Bucky was spacing out while staring at you again. That would be the second time since you got here.

You tried to pull your hand away but he had a good grip. Your whole face turned red. “James?” Your voice sounded distant to Bucky but he answered. “Call me Bucky.” His voice deep and gravelly as he pulled his hand back. How can someone’s voice be so…sexy? You blushed even harder at your thoughts.

“So Y/N, is there anything you want to talk about, or want?” Bucky knew that with that adorably pink face he wanted to just leave kisses all over it. “Oh, um.” You stopped talking to reach into your purse. Bucky blinked a few times, surprised at what you pulled out. I’m your hands was one of his T-shirts that Tony sells. It was white with an outline of him on it.

“C-Could you sign this?” You shakily handed it over. Bucky blushed slightly. You smiled at this. He quickly signed it. “I didn’t know people bought this stuff.” Bucky chuckled, handing it back. Your face lit up at this. “Really? I love this stuff!” Bucky smiled.

“I think it’s so cool that you guys go out and save the world. I could never do anything like that. Not to mention, all the stuff you went through and you still have hope to help people. You are pretty handsome too.” You didn’t realize you were ranting until the handsome part slipped out. Your face turned beat red.

Bucky had slight pink cheeks. Steve looked out of the corner of his eye and chuckled. Bucky slapped his leg underneath the table. “You’re pretty cute.” Bucky chuckled, not realizing where all this confidence came from. That statement alone made you a stuttering mess.

“Oh, t-thank y-you.” Bucky couldn’t help but notice how beautiful your eyes were. They seemed to shine in the light. Bucky was still feeling confident and he wanted to ride this confidence. “How about we get some coffee tomorrow morning?”

“R-Really?” Bucky laughed. It was wonderful to hear. “Yeah, just let me give you my number.” You nodded pulling out your phone, and handing it to him. He walked around the table handing it to you. “I’ll pick you up tomorrow at 8?” You smiled the biggest smile ever.

“I’ll see you tomorrow!” “Bucky it’s time to go.” Steve interrupted. Only then did you notice everyone else was gone. “Alright, Cap.” Bucky turned to you, leaning down giving you a peck on the cheek. “Text me.” Bucky smiled. As he left you stood there holding your cheek. You have a date with the Bucky Barnes.

Today couldn’t of been better.

You are pretty handsome too.” You didn’t realize you were ranting until the handsome part slipped out. Your face turned beat red.

Bucky had slight pink cheeks. Steve looked out of the corner of his eye and chuckled. Bucky slapped his leg underneath the table. “You’re pretty cute.” Bucky chuckled, not realizing where all this confidence came from. That statement alone made you a stuttering mess.

“Oh, t-thank y-you.” Bucky couldn’t help but notice how beautiful your eyes were. They seemed to shine in the light. Bucky was still feeling confident and he wanted to ride this confidence. “How about we get some coffee tomorrow morning?”

“R-Really?” Bucky laughed. It was wonderful to hear. “Yeah, just let me give you my number.” You nodded pulling out your phone, and handing it to him. He walked around the table handing it to you. “I’ll pick you up tomorrow at 8?” You smiled the biggest smile ever.

“I’ll see you tomorrow!” “Bucky it’s time to go.” Steve interrupted. Only then did you notice everyone else was gone. “Alright, Cap.” Bucky turned to you, leaning down giving you a peck on the cheek. “Text me.” Bucky smiled. As he left you stood there holding your cheek. You have a date with the Bucky Barnes.

Today couldn’t of been better.

summary: Michael Douglas, AKA Hank Pym, will be here soon to answer your questions about Marvel Studios’ #AntManAndTheWasp! Be sure to...
title: Michael Douglas, AKA Hank Pym, will be here soon to answer your questions about Marvel Studios’ #AntManAndTheWasp! Be sure to follow along with #AskMichaelDouglas starting at 2pm ET/11am PT. https://t.co/2B6rSRKMEj

blog.name: why-i-love-comics
blog.title: A blog dedicated to all your favorite moments
blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me... Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. Tomasi                                                                         all spoiler posts are tagged "wednesday spoilers"                                             add me on snapchapt! taskrnaster (with an RN instead of M)

summary: Without You - Unoriginal_Fangirl - Multifandom [Archive of Our Own]
body:

title: Comic Book Review: Shuri #1
body:
Comic Book Review: Shuri #1

I have to say that Marvel has impressed me this year with the strong focus on the world of Wakanda. After a successful release of Black Panther in theaters, that was pretty much the kick needed for them to revitalize this corner of the Marvel Universe. While I’m sure that some comic fans out there would want to see these characters in their original forms, I find that this new take on characters…

title: Once Upon A Dream
body:

by anotsosecretfangirl

Peter has a nightmare and goes to the tower to calm down (i.e. to check that his mentor’s okay). Tony assures him that even if something did happen, he would move heaven and earth to get back to him.

blog.name: queenpersephonesgarden
blog.title: persephone writes
blog.description: The ramblings of @fandomsallaroundme, aka the writing blog of AO3 author QueenPersephoneofHades.

title: Whumptober Day 17
body:
Prompt: Drugged
Fandom: Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), Marvel
Characters: Nebula, Thanos
Word Count: 310

They don’t put her under until halfway through the operation.

It is a lesson, they tell her, that she must learn; a punishment, for striking Gamora’s face so hard when she’d finally thought she’d had the upper hand in their duel. Gamora is Father’s favorite, they say, so using unwarranted force against her is tantamount to attacking Father.

Nebula hadn’t cared about that, at the time; she’d just wanted to see Father’s perfect little warrior bleed a little.

She’d still lost, of course she had, but she had managed to bruise her ‘sister’s perfectly pretty face so badly the left half of her face had swollen to a yellowish bruise before the match was over.

Gamora came away with a victory and a vibrant bruise that would heal in time.

Nebula was dragged away with a loss and a new modification scheduled within the hour.

Her ribcage is afire, hands and blades sinking into her guts at random intervals, in and out, and she can do nothing to stop them.

They ignore her shrieks of agony, chide her like a disobedient child when she spasms hard against her restraints, clean up the blood pouring from her heaving chest with a bored detachment that is common for the Chitauri people.

She screams threats of torture and murder at deaf ears, and only manages to wrench one hand free of the cuffs holding her to the table before a deep baritone voice relents.

“You may knock her out, now.”

She jerks hard again, eyes rolling in her frothing desperation to find him.

Father stands in the doorway to the operating theater, face a stony mask of disapproval and arms crossed in front of him.

“You’re only making this worse for yourself,” he remarks idly.

“Fuck you!” Nebula barely manages to snarl before the surgeon injects something, and everything goes utterly, blessedly dark.
